sentence.Network_en: The group perform variations on soul and gospel music.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个乐队演奏灵歌和福音音乐的变奏曲。

sentence.Network_en: He preached the Gospel to the heathen locals from this spot.
sentence.Network_cn: 他曾在这里向不信教的当地人宣讲《福音书》。

sentence.Network_en: I had to go to church, so I grew up singing gospel.
sentence.Network_cn: 我必须去教堂做礼拜，因此我是唱着福音歌长大的。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English gōdspel, from gōd 'good' + spel 'news, a story' (see spell), translating ecclesiastical Latin bona annuntiatio or bonus nuntius, used to gloss ecclesiastical Latin evangelium, from Greek euangelion 'good news' (see evangel); after the vowel was shortened in Old English, the first syllable was mistaken for god 'God'

encyclopedia.content: 简介 gospel Literally “the good news” that Jesus’ death on the cross pays for our sins and brings us into a relationship with God. entry.tran: 福音书（《圣经·新约》中记录耶稣基督生平和教诲的四卷书）
entry.def: In the New Testament of the Bible, the Gospels are the four books which describe the life and teachings of Jesus Christ.

example.ex: ...an illustrated and illuminated manuscript of the four gospels.
example.tran: 配有插图、装饰华美的四福音书手抄本

entry.tran: 福音（耶稣的启示和教义）
entry.def: In the Christian religion, the gospel refers to the message and teachings of Jesus Christ, as explained in the New Testament.

example.ex: I didn't shirk my duties. I visited the sick and I preached the gospel.
example.tran: 我没有逃避职责，我探望病人，也宣讲福音。

entry.def: You can use gospel to refer to a particular way of thinking that a person or group believes in very strongly and that they try to persuade others to accept.

example.ex: It taught only materialism, the gospel of mammon.
example.tran: 它只是宣扬金钱至上的物欲主义。

entry.tran: 福音音乐（尤流行于美国南部黑人基督徒中）
entry.def: Gospel or gospel music is a style of religious music that uses strong rhythms and vocal harmony. It is especially popular among black Christians in the southern United States of America.

example.ex: I had to go to church, so I grew up singing gospel...
example.tran: 我必须去教堂做礼拜，因此我是唱着福音歌长大的。

example.ex: The group perform variations on soul and gospel music.
example.tran: 这个乐队演奏灵歌和福音音乐的变奏曲。

entry.def: If you take something as gospel, or as gospel truth, you believe that it is completely true.

example.ex: The results were not to be taken as gospel...
example.tran: 别以为这些结果就一定是正确的。

example.ex: He wouldn't say this if it weren't the gospel truth.
example.tran: 要不是对此深信不疑，他不会说这样的话。

means.word_mean: 2. a genre of a capella music originating with Black slaves in the United States and featuring call and response; influential on the development of other genres of popular music (especially soul)
3. the written body of teachings of a religious group that are generally accepted by that group
4. a doctrine that is believed to be of great importance;

sentences.sentence: "Newton's writings were gospel for those who followed"

auth_sentence.content: One of our texts is the Gospel of Thomas.
auth_sentence.res_content: One of our texts is the Gospel of Thomas.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: One of our texts is the Gospel of Thomas.

auth_sentence.content: Perhaps the Gospel of Mary was just too radical.
auth_sentence.res_content: Perhaps the Gospel of Mary was just too radical.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Perhaps the Gospel of Mary was just too radical.

means.word_mean: 原则, 主义, 信条

sentences.en: They continue to preach their gospel of self-reliance.
sentences.cn: 他们继续倡导自立的信条。

sentences.en: What I'm telling you is gospel.
sentences.cn: 我告诉你的事是千真万确的。

jushi.english: The man was preaching the Gospel.
All these hostages took a solemn oath on the gospels.
jushi.chinese: 这些人质都手按着福音书立下了庄重的誓言。

jushi.english: He preached on a text from St. John's Gospel .
jushi.chinese: 他以《圣约翰福音》中的文句作讲道的题目。
